data.enText: a child whose parents are dead

data.chText: 他是个孤儿，和他叔叔一起生活。
data.enText: He was an orphan and lived with his uncle.

data.chText: 父母双亡的男孩 / 女孩

data.enText: to make a child an orphan
She was orphaned in the war.

tr: a young animal without a mother
the first line of a paragraph that is set as the last line of a page or column
a child who has lost both parents
someone or something who lacks support or care or supervision

value.def: An orphan is a child whose parents are dead.

example.ex: I'm an orphan and pretty much grew up on my own.
example.tran: 我是个孤儿，差不多是靠自己长大的。

example.ex: ...a young orphan girl brought up by peasants...
example.tran: 由农民抚养长大的幼小孤女

value.def: If a child is orphaned, their parents die, or their remaining parent dies.

example.ex: Jones was orphaned at the age of ten, and taken in by next-door neighbours...
example.tran: 琼斯10岁时成为孤儿，被隔壁的邻居收养。

example.ex: By the end of the decade, some ten million children are expected to have been orphaned by the disease.
example.tran: 到这个10年结束时，大约1,000万儿童将会因为这种疾病而失去双亲。

example.ex: ..a fifteen-year-old boy left orphaned by the recent disaster.
example.tran: 被最近的那场灾难夺走了父母的15岁男孩
